meanings.definition: To make or become tight or tighter.
meanings.sent1: She tightened her grip on the handle to hold on tight.
meanings.sent2: He tightened the screws to secure the shelf in place.
meanings.sent3: The magician tightened the knot so much, it disappeared!
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room tightened like a coiled spring.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind tightened its icy grip around us.

meanings.definition: To become more strict or restrictive.
meanings.sent1: The teacher tightened the rules to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The security measures at the airport tightened after the incident.
meanings.sent3: The town council tightened the noise regulations, banning loud music after 10 PM.
meanings.sent4: The grip of fear tightened around his heart as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the courtroom tightened as the judge prepared to deliver the verdict.

meanings.definition: To make a financial situation more secure or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The company tightened its budget to avoid layoffs.
meanings.sent2: The government tightened regulations to prevent economic collapse.
meanings.sent3: The accountant tightened the financial controls to prevent fraud.
meanings.sent4: The market tightened as investors became more cautious.
meanings.sent5: The economic crisis tightened its grip on the struggling nation.
